meanings.definition: An organism consisting of a cell or cells in which the genetic material is DNA in the form of chromosomes contained within a distinct nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The eukaryote has a nucleus that holds its DNA.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study different types of eukaryotes to understand their genetic makeup.
meanings.sent3: The eukaryote's nucleus is like a safe deposit box for its DNA.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, the eukaryote's nucleus is the command center.
meanings.sent5: The eukaryote's DNA is like a treasure map hidden in its nucleus.

meanings.definition: A member of the domain Eukaryota, which includes all organisms with eukaryotic cells.
meanings.sent1: The biologist classified the organism as a eukaryote based on its cell structure.
meanings.sent2: Eukaryotes are found in various ecosystems around the world.
meanings.sent3: At the eukaryote party, everyone had a nucleus to call their own.
meanings.sent4: Being a eukaryote in the animal kingdom is like being part of a big family.
meanings.sent5: The diversity of eukaryotes is a testament to the complexity of life on Earth.
